meanings.definition: A quick, light blow or punch.
meanings.sent1: He gave the ball a little bop with his hand.
meanings.sent2: The clown's nose made a funny bop sound when he hit it.
meanings.sent3: The bop on the door was so gentle, I almost missed it.
meanings.sent4: Her words felt like a bop to his ego.
meanings.sent5: The bop on the table made the glass wobble.

meanings.definition: A style of jazz characterized by fast tempo and rhythmic complexity.
meanings.sent1: The band played a lively bop that got everyone dancing.
meanings.sent2: The bop music had a catchy beat that made people tap their feet.
meanings.sent3: Listening to the bop made her feel like she was in a fancy club.
meanings.sent4: The bop of the drums echoed through the room, setting the mood.
meanings.sent5: The bop of the bass guitar added depth to the jazz performance.

meanings.definition: To dance or move energetically to music.
meanings.sent1: She loves to bop around the living room when her favorite song plays.
meanings.sent2: The kids started to bop to the music as soon as it started.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to bop along with the beat, but it looked funny.
meanings.sent4: His heart seemed to bop in time with the music, full of joy.
meanings.sent5: The crowd began to bop in unison, creating a lively atmosphere.
